title: Intermittent failure of TestCollectEnv.test_expect
body_html:
The failing diff usually looks something like:

06:19:31   Versions of relevant libraries:
06:19:31   [pip] numpy (1.14.X)
06:19:31 - [pip] torch (0.5.0a0
06:19:31 + [pip] torch (0.5.0a0)
06:19:31 ?                     +

I thought this was some weird buffering problem, but then I looked more carefully at the test, and one of the regexes looks VERY suspicious:

        version_hash_regex = re.compile(r'(a\d+)\+.......')
        result = re.sub(version_hash_regex, r'\1', info_output).strip()

If the size of the short version hash varies, this regex will gobble more or less. It really shouldn't be hardcoded as wildcard periods.

CC @zou3519

body:
The failing diff usually looks something like:

```
06:19:31   Versions of relevant libraries:
06:19:31   [pip] numpy (1.14.X)
06:19:31 - [pip] torch (0.5.0a0
06:19:31 + [pip] torch (0.5.0a0)
06:19:31 ?                     +
```

I thought this was some weird buffering problem, but then I looked more carefully at the test, and one of the regexes looks VERY suspicious:

```
        version_hash_regex = re.compile(r'(a\d+)\+.......')
        result = re.sub(version_hash_regex, r'\1', info_output).strip()
```

If the size of the short version hash varies, this regex will gobble more or less. It really shouldn't be hardcoded as wildcard periods.

CC @zou3519
